com.google.gwt.widgetideas.table.client
Class ScrollTable

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel
              com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.ComplexPanel
                  com.google.gwt.widgetideas.table.client.ScrollTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IndexedPanel, ResizableWidget
Direct Known Subclasses:
PagingScrollTable
public class ScrollTable
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.ComplexPanel
implements ResizableWidget

ScrollTable consists of a fixed header and footer (optional) that remain visible and a scrollable body that contains the data.

In order for the columns in the header table and data table to line up, the two table must have the same margin, padding, and border widths. You can use CSS style sheets to manipulate the colors and styles of the cell's, but you must keep the actual sizes consistent (especially with respect to the left and right side of the cells).

CSS Style Rules

  • .gwt-ScrollTable { applied to the entire widget }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable-header { applied to the header table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable-data { applied to the data table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable-footer { applied to the footer table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable-header-wrapper { wrapper around the header table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable-data-wrapper { wrapper around the data table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable-footer-wrapper { wrapper around the footer table }

Field Detail

DEFAULT_STYLE_NAME

public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_STYLE_NAME
The default style name.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESIZE_POLICY_UNCONSTRAINED

public static final int RESIZE_POLICY_UNCONSTRAINED
Columns will expand and shrink independently of each other.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESIZE_POLICY_FLOW

public static final int RESIZE_POLICY_FLOW
As one column expands or shrinks, the columns to the right will do the opposite, trying to maintain the same size. The user can still expand the grid if there is no more space to take from the columns on the right.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESIZE_POLICY_FILL_WIDTH

public static final int RESIZE_POLICY_FILL_WIDTH
Same as FIXED_WIDTH, but the grid will always fill the available width, even if the widget is resized.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESIZE_POLICY_FIXED_WIDTH

public static final int RESIZE_POLICY_FIXED_WIDTH
As one column expands or shrinks, the columns to the right will do the opposite, trying to maintain the same size. The width of the grid will remain constant, ignoring column resizing that would result in the grid growing in size.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Parameters:

Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

fillWidth

public void fillWidth()
Adjust all column widths so they take up the maximum amount of space without needing a horizontal scroll bar. The distribution will be proportional to the current width of each column. The ScrollTable must be visible on the page for this method to work.

redraw

public void redraw()
Redraw the table. This is a relatively cheap operation and should be called after modifying the header or footer sections.

setColumnSortable

public void setColumnSortable(int column,
                              boolean sortable)
Enable or disable sorting on a specific column. All columns are sortable by default. Use setSortingEnabled(boolean) to disable sorting on all columns.

Parameters:
column - the index of the column
sortable - true to enable sorting for this column, false to disable

setFooterTable

public void setFooterTable(HasFixedColumnWidth footerTable)
Set the footer table that appears under the data table. If set to null, the footer table will not be shown.

Parameters:
footerTable - the table to use in the footer

setScrollingEnabled

public void setScrollingEnabled(boolean scrollingEnabled)
Enable or disable scrolling of the data area. If enabled, the data area will be confined to a scrollable area. If disabled, the entire ScrollTable will grow vertically so all of the data area is visible.

Parameters:
scrollingEnabled - true to enable data scrolling

setSortingEnabled

public void setSortingEnabled(boolean sortingEnabled)
Enable or disable column sorting via mouse clicks to the header cells.

Parameters:
sortingEnabled - true to enable column sorting via mouse events
